License - Individual grants Lifeway together with its affiliates, subsidiaries, parent companies and their representatives and employees have an unlimited, perpetual, non-exclusive, worldwide and, except as set forth in Section 9, royalty-free, right to use, reuse, publish, reproduce, perform, copy, create derivative works, exhibit, broadcast, and display throughout the world the name, image and likeness of Individual in Marketing Materials (as defined below) in connection with marketing, advertising or otherwise promoting the Lifeway products and/or services and for historical reference and display purposes and other internal purposes, including without limitation, internal sales meetings. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, Lifeway shall be under no obligation to cause the Marketing Materials to be displayed, published or performed. Individual further waives the right to inspect or approve the Marketing Materials.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. License - Individual grants Lifeway together with its affiliates, subsidiaries, parent companies and their representatives and employees have an unlimited, non-exclusive, worldwide right to use, reuse, publish, reproduce, perform, copy, create derivative works, exhibit, broadcast, and display throughout the world the name, image and likeness of Individual in Marketing Materials (as defined below) in connection with marketing, advertising or otherwise promoting the Lifeway products and/or services. Lifeway shall be under no obligation to cause the Marketing Materials to be displayed, published or performed. Individual further waives the right to inspect or approve the Marketing Materials. The duration of this license is limited to the term of this agreement and any renewals thereof, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause grants Lifeway a *perpetual* license. The modified clause states that the license is limited to the term of the agreement, creating a contradiction about the license's duration. This introduces uncertainty about Lifeway's rights after the agreement's initial term.

perturbation.changed_text:
9. Compensation
(a) In consideration of the rights granted by Individual hereunder, Lifeway agrees to pay Individual a royalty (the "Royalty") equal to $0.02 for each Lifeway product or individual item sold by Lifeway during each calendar month of the Term bearing Individual's first name, last name or other identifying personal characteristics. All Royalty payments shall be made in U.S. dollars in cash or to the order of Individual and shall be due and payable within thirty (30) days after the end of each calendar month for sales during the previous month.
(b) All amounts due under this Agreement are net of any applicable taxes, duties, fees or governmental charges, including without limitation, transfer tax, sales tax, use tax, consumption tax, value-added tax, excise tax, import tax, export tax, and custom duties (collectively "Taxes"). Accordingly, Lifeway will be solely responsible for the payment of all Taxes, together with any related liabilities (including interest and penalties), imposed upon it by law or any governmental authority for which Lifeway is primarily liable.
(c) The Royalty due hereunder shall be paid to Individual at the address set forth above. However, Lifeway reserves the right to adjust the Royalty payment based on market conditions and Individual's continued compliance with the terms of this agreement. Any such adjustments will be communicated to the Individual in writing prior to implementation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a fixed royalty and conditions for cessation. The modified text introduces 'Lifeway reserves the right to adjust the Royalty payment based on market conditions' which creates uncertainty and contradicts the initially defined, seemingly fixed, royalty. This gives Lifeway discretionary power to alter the compensation, conflicting with the original intention of the clause.

perturbation.original_text: 12. Assignment - Neither party will assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party, such consent not to be unreasonably, conditioned, withheld or delayed.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. Assignment - Lifeway may assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement to any affiliate or subsidiary without the prior written consent of the Individual. However, the Individual will not assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of Lifeway, such consent not to be unreasonably, conditioned, withheld or delayed.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires mutual consent for assignment. The modified clause allows Lifeway to assign its rights to affiliates without the Individual's consent, while still requiring Lifeway's consent for the Individual's assignment. This introduces an imbalance in assignment rights, creating a contradiction and potential disputes regarding assignment flexibility.
